KANKA.browser.error.provideAccessToken: You did not provide a valid Kanka access token or it has expired.
KANKA.browser.error.selectCampaign: Please ensure that you have selected a campaign in the settings.
KANKA.browser.error.actionError: An error occurred while performing the requested action.
KANKA.browser.error.loadEntity: An error occurred while loading the list of entities from Kanka.
KANKA.browser.filter.label: Filter
KANKA.browser.title: Kanka Journal Import
KANKA.journal.character.labels.title: Title
KANKA.settings.token.label: Kanka Personal Access Token
KANKA.settings.token.hint: You can retrieve an access token from https://kanka.io/en/settings/api
KANKA.settings.campaign.label: Campaign
KANKA.settings.campaign.hint: Select the campaign from which to import entries.
KANKA.settings.campaign.noToken: Please enter a valid access token
KANKA.settings.locale.label: Content language
KANKA.settings.locale.hint: This setting allows you to set the language which will be used for labels if it should be different from your default Foundry language. This only supports languages for which translations were provided.
KANKA.settings.importPrivate.label: Show private entities
KANKA.settings.importPrivate.hint: If this is unchecked private entities will be hidden from the import browser.
KANKA.settings.disableExternalLinks.hint: If this is checked all mention links to entries that were not imported to Foundry will be removed.
KANKA.settings.imageInText.label: Include image in text
KANKA.settings.imageInText.hint: Should the image be include next to the text in addition to the regular journal entry image?
KANKA.settings.treeStructure.label: Create folder tree
KANKA.settings.treeStructure.hint: Should Kankas tree structure be replicated via folders? The maximum depth is 3 folders.
KANKA.settings.error.ErrorInvalidAccessT: The given Kanka access token is invalid.
KANKA.settings.error.ErrorTokenExpired: Your Kanka access token is expired. Please provide a new one.
KANKA.settings.error.WarningTokenExpirat: Your Kanka access token is going to expire withing the next week. Please provide a new one.
KANKA.settings.error.fetchError: There was an error fetching data from Kanka. Please check your settings and try again.
KANKA.migration.dialog.text:
Kanka-Foundry migration

You have recently updated the Kanka-Foundry module from 1.x to this current version. This update brought a lot of big changes to how the module imports and handles data from Kanka, in order to allow for an improved user experience and more features.

You currently have

  • {documentCount} journal entries
  • {folderCount} folders

that were created by Kanka-Foundry and need to be updated in order to properly work and take advantage of the new features. One change is, that journal entries imported from kanka are no longer editable. That was never truly supported anyways, as changes were overwritten with the next import and could not be synced back to Kanka.

If you have changed any of the imported journal entries by hand:

Backup your data now! Upgrading will overwrite all imported journal entries!

Please refer to the modules Github repository to see all changes of the new version. If you want to keep the old version, you'll have to skip the migration now, manually downgrade to an older release (all available at github) and lock the module version in the package manager screen (a new feature of Foundry 0.8.x).

Do you want to upgrade your existing journal entries to the new version? This will start a reimport from Kanka for all imported journal entries and overwrite the versions you currently have synced. This might take a few minutes, depending on the size of your Kanka campaign and the amount of synced entries. You will receive a notification once it's done.

But I already ran this migration!

You might have synced entries from multiple campaigns. This migration only updates entries from the currently selected campaign ({campaignName}). If you keep getting this message, change the selected campaign in the modules settings and reload your browser to try again.

Should you keep running into trouble, please let me know by creating an issue in Github.
